attributes.action: Ban new incinerator and pyrolysis sites and invest in waste reduction
attributes.background: We want the government to follow the example set in the EU by banning any new incinerators for the purpose of waste disposal. They should also ban pyrolysis facilities, and instead seek the solutions we need to reduce waste completely by investing in waste reduction, reuse and recycling.
attributes.additional_details:
Unfortunately waste management companies are benefitting from not having to pay similar taxes to that which are imposed on land-fill.

Communities across the breadth of the UK have campaigned against waste incinerators as many do not want one in their town or city.

The reasons for this are clear:

1) Incinerators risk harm to the health of local residents
2) Incinerators can pollute the air with toxic emissions
3) Incinerator emissions contribute to global warming
4) Incinerators can harm the environment

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Ban plastic packaging for fruit and vegetables
attributes.background: France and Spain have recently pledged to ban plastic packaging for fruit and vegetables from January 2022. We want the UK Government to follow suit and reduce unnecessary plastic waste.
attributes.additional_details: Plastic waste does not biodegrade. It gets into the environment, into the oceans and can cause injury or death to animals. Even if recycled properly, plastic packaging needs to be managed by the local council. Reducing the amount we purchase would reduce this burden and save taxpayers money. Fruit and veg is often transported long distances without plastic and packaged for sale to enhance presentation. It is not needed to protect the fruit.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Provide funding for suitable infrastructure for people living in vehicles
attributes.background:
I call on the Government to address the standards of living for the growing number of people living in vehicles.
 
This can be achieved by funding infrastructure similar to that in parts of Europe, with safe places to sleep, access to fresh water and areas to dispose of Grey and Brown water.
attributes.additional_details:
Following a rise in living costs, the number of people forced or choosing to live in vehicles has grown considerably.
 
Far too many councils are hostile towards those living in vehicles, and some are systematically removing safe spaces.
 
I call on the Government to financially support councils in providing safe facilities, like overnight parking, fresh water and waste management, rather than removing options and leaving those living in vehicles with no alternatives.

departments.name: Department for Levelling Up, Housing and Communities

attributes.action: Include gardening in the National Curriculum
attributes.background: As part of their science classes, children could have an applied session to plant and harvest vegetables. In the process, they could learn the benefits of growing one's greens, composting & recycling & the benefits for the environment.
attributes.additional_details: Education is the basis of a good, responsible citizen. In light of the current climate, it is important that future generations understand the basis of a sustainable economy, food sourcing and waste management.

attributes.action: Make it Mandatory for the UK to recycle it's own waste in the UK
attributes.background: Make it Mandatory for the UK to recycle it's own waste in the UK, Ensure no UK waste is sent abroad for disposal, processing or recycling.
attributes.additional_details: Because it needs to be Mandatory across all areas of the UK & All Councils and apply to all public and private waste management companies.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Create Environmental Impact ratings for businesses with associated fines/reliefs
attributes.background: Implement a simple 5-point rating system similar to hygiene rating, but for all UK businesses and public bodies on their environmental impact, covering all aspects of business supply chain and product life. There would be fines for low performers and financial relief for high performers.
attributes.additional_details:
Implement a 5-point rating system for all businesses in the UK for Environmental Impact. Scoring 1 to 5 similar to hygiene rating. Example would be:
1: High Impact
2: Moderate Impact
3: Mild Impact
4: Minimal or Negligible
5: Beneficial to environment
This would cover suppliers, product life, end of life, transport, energy supply, waste management, impact on environment, dealing with detrimental suppliers. Low scoring businesses will incur fines, and high scoring businesses financial relief.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Pay all breaks for NHS employees
attributes.background: Currently it’s normal practice for meal and rest breaks for NHS employees to be unpaid. This is enshrined in the NHS terms and conditions of employment. Please abolish this and pay staff for all rostered hours including breaks.
attributes.additional_details: This practice is mean, antagonistic, demoralising and disproportionately impacts staff in the busiest front-line roles who are often forced to work for free through their breaks. We shouldn’t be deducting 15 minute tea breaks. It is wasteful of ward managers’ time, having to police deductions of breaks from casual, emergency and overtime shifts. The entire NHS would benefit from removal of this penalty.

departments.name: Department of Health and Social Care

attributes.action: Create legal requirements for schools to reduce, reuse and recycle
attributes.background: It is estimated that the UK education sector produces upwards of 210,000 tonnes of waste every year. Schools carry the responsibility of reducing and recycling waste. Fulfilling this responsibility should be mandated by law.
attributes.additional_details:
Every school should have a legal responsibility to ensure that a sufficient school waste management system is in place to reduce, reuse and recycle. Schools are viewed by some as role models for eco-friendly waste management, and this somewhat daunting responsibility must be addressed appropriately by every school.
 
Legislation on waste and recycling should be updated so that schools must recycle!

attributes.action: End provision of agricultural subsidies for managed grouse moorland in England
attributes.background: Alter the criteria required to qualify for agricultural subsidy to exclude sectors which do not generate any important food source, (e.g. land management for grouse shooting). A threshold of minimum food production per hectare should be implemented.
attributes.additional_details: Grouse moors in England provide only 1520 full time jobs in England (2016, Countryside alliance, National gamekeepers association), and occupy 8% of the total land area of Britain. No food source of significant importance is provided by management of land for grouse shooting. Grouse moors represent a devastatingly inefficient waste of land use. Agricultural subsidies are intended to maintain stable food prices, and taxpayers are not getting value for money by supporting this wasteful industry.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Introduce a 4 day working week
attributes.background: Introduce a 4 day working week (albeit maintaining the salary levels) thereby reducing unemployment, encouraging economic growth, taking advantage of the post pandemic momentum, achieving better efficiencies by working from home and reducing travel times.
attributes.additional_details: reduce unemployment, encourage economic growth, better work life balance, improved mental health, improved efficiencies and time management, encourage automation and reducing waste and child care costs for overstretched families, reducing the need in government support of lower income households.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/566626

attributes.action: Object the Japan’s decision to discharge nuclear waste into the Pacific .
attributes.background: Japan recently approved a plan to discharge over 1 million tonnes of radioactive waste from the Fukushima nuclear plant into the sea, starting in September 2022. As a decision that risks contaminating collective resource, we insist that parliament makes a formal objection to the Japanese Government.
attributes.additional_details:
The NGO said Japan's plans to release the water showed the government "once again failed the people of Fukushima". To not make an objection to this decision would fail, not only the people of the UK, but the entirety of living species. We urge parliament to:

1. Initiate parliamentary discussions surrounding what can be done to prevent these plans from going forward.

2. In the meantime, ministers should consider, and encourage Japan to follow, an alternative plan to manage its chemical waste.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/582867

attributes.action: Reopen garden centres during the Coronavirus lockdown, to reduce waste.
attributes.background:
Please consider the reopening of garden centres, during the Coronavirus lockdown, to preserve the physical and mental wellbeing of the population, avoid potential bankruptcy of these businesses and stop the waste of thousands of plants.
Apply social distancing rules, the same as supermarkets.
attributes.additional_details:
Reopening garden centres would save these businesses from risk of bankruptcy, stop thousands of plants from going to waste and boost the morale, physical and mental wellbeing  of countless people throughout the UK, for whom gardening is hugely beneficial.
As with supermarkets, garden centre managers can apply social distancing rules, such as floor markings, signs and separate entrances and exits. During this period of uncertainty, gardening is a vital activity for individuals in self isolation.

rejection.details:
Since you started your petition the Government has added garden centres and plant nurseries to the list of businesses that are permitted to open: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/further-businesses-and-premises-to-close/further-businesses-and-premises-to-close-guidance

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.
 
Find out more and watch the Committee put questions suggested by petitioners to Government Ministers and the Deputy Chief Medical Officer: https://committees.parliament.uk/committee/326/petitions-committee/news/145767/committee-question-deputy-chief-medical-officer-and-ministers-on-coronavirus-response/
 
Read letters asking further questions of Government Ministers: https://committees.parliament.uk/committee/326/petitions-committee/publications/3/correspondence/

attributes.action: Stop water pollution in the Lake District
attributes.background: I want there should be a ban on water pollution in the Lake District world heritage site. I was disgusted to find out that raw sewage was allowed to flow into Lake Windermere for 1700 hours in 2020 as part of the overflow system at Ambleside waste management plant.
attributes.additional_details: I believe this issue requires governmental intervention to make it law and to hold those who do pollute the lakes, rivers and waters to be held accountable. I want the rivers and lakes to be clean for the people that utilise them and especially for the wildlife that call the Lake District home.

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or House of Commons is responsible for.

Decisions about managing pollution in the Lake District are a matter for the relevant local authorities and environmental agencies, not the Government or House of Commons. As a result it is not possible for the Government or House of Commons to take the action you have requested.

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Ban Water Companies discharging raw sewage into water courses: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/582336

attributes.action: Limit public sector spending on external consultants
attributes.background: With news that the Government is paying £7,000 per day for test and trace consultants (meaning one test and trace consultant costs more than several dozen Band 1 nurses, who risk their lives every day) the Government should cap the cost of consultants used by the public sector at £500 per day.
attributes.additional_details: The Government is paying £7,000 per day to some management consultants. There is no justification for paying this amount for external consultancy, and public sector spending on external consultants should be limited. These rates are obscene and an absurd waste of public money which is ultimately paid by the taxpayer. We need to stop wasting money like this.

attributes.action: Stop local councils from privatising waste collection
attributes.background: The Government should stop local councils from privatising waste collection. This action by councils delegates their responsibility to create a clean and healthy environment for residents to private service providers who can profit at the expense of tax payers.
attributes.additional_details: Tax payers’ money shouldn’t be used to enrich private waste management companies, who are reported to make billions of pounds in revenue every year. According to the Office for National Statistics, waste management companies’ spending comes to just under £9.4 billion year.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Ban plastic or Plastic-Hybrid disposable cups in coffeeshops/restaurants.
attributes.background: During this nationwide lockdown, coffee shops and restaurants have been closed. In that time, over 15 million plastic and non-recyclable cups haven't been thrown away and as consumers we feel it would be massively beneficial to introduce laws to prevent their use post-covid19 lockdown.
attributes.additional_details: In taking this first step and providing precedent for other countries to follow suit, there would be a far reduced strain on our waste services, and as consumers we must be held responsible for our purchases. This current generation of cups are lined with plastic and therefore difficult and comparatively expensive to recycle, meaning far too many slip through the net into landfill, which is a terrible solution to waste management. Discussion of this issue is pertinent to out survival! Thank you!

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition instead: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300152.

attributes.action: Change, rules, make laws to protect children/parents from unnecessary separation
attributes.background: To change laws and make mandatory rulings to prevent  social services constantly making mistakes bye making them have to wear body cameras, follow strict procedures, and to not be allowed to take action  on opinions and suspicion alone without solid evidence or following the correct procedures
attributes.additional_details:
To stop children and parents being unnecessarily separated enabling social services to provide more resources for the children who ARE in need of urgent support and protection. 
This needs to be a priority because while social services are getting it wrong due to unprofessional agents and management acting on suspicion or rumours without procedures or evidence they are actually wasting resources and actually causing multiple types of abuse while their aren’t enough resources for the real victims

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about families being separated by social services, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

There are already strict rules in place regarding the removal of children, and this can only happen if a court has issued a care order,

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Make it mandatory for social services workers to wear a body camera: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/577074

Make it a specific criminal offence for social workers to lie: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/579565

If there are specific changes you want to see to the rules relating to child social services and care orders you could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Allow for waste & recycling centres to be re-opened
attributes.background: Currently local waste & recycling services are closed across the country due to councils following national government guidelines. We petition the government to re-designate waste & recycling service workers as key workers during the current crisis, such that local councils can then re-open services
attributes.additional_details: The current approach taken is short sighted and is leading to increasing infection risks rather than containing them by increasing the amount of illegal fly tipping occurring across the country, and by requiring households to retain more waste materials on the their premises for longer. The nature of a waste & recycling centres involve little person to person contact in comparison to other areas already designated as key services, and so there is no reason a well managed service cannot be run.

rejection.details:
Since you started your petition, waste and recycling centres in England have been reopening.

The operation and opening times of individual sites is a matter for local councils.

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here: 

www.gov.uk/coronavirus 

https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/ 

The Government has also created an online service to help you out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support 

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

attributes.action: Protect hedgerow habitat from excessive use of mechanised equipment
attributes.background:
Make annual / biannual hedge and underbrush cutting with tractor-driven blades illegal.
Licence flail and rotary cutting equipment operation.
Ensure setaside subsidies are provided only where the entire ecosystem within the given boundary is protected, including hedgerow cover in such a mandate.
attributes.additional_details: Annual and bi-annual hedge cutting across the UK has brought about sharp declines of hedgerow-dependent wildlife. There is widely visible evidence that Government guidelines on the frequency of mechanised cuts are not being followed and field margin setaside payments are being wasted on sterile ecosystems as a result. The Health and Harmony document cites the importance of sustainable land management and the role landowners play in the welfare of the countryside. We agree with this citation.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is a decision for landowners.

attributes.action: Reduce cutting our roadside verges
attributes.background: Adopt the wildlife-friendly management guidelines jointly coined by Plantlife, the Highways Authorities and other organizations on Hampshire’s roadside verges, to help wildlife and the environment, creating Carbon sinks, saving money, and achieving governmental land and environment targets.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently, many roadside verges in my home county (Hampshire) are cut 12+ times annually, wasting our taxes, and suppressing a valuable wildlife habitat. If Plantlife's management guide were adopted, these featureless verges would turn into wildflower meadows, growing far slower than the current turfs, and absorbing Carbon 3x faster than Forest. The management guide details exactly how this will be done practically and safely. Please only sign this if you live/work/study in Hampshire.

Thankyou.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action:

Work with councils to promote wildflower and grassland growth
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/585792

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/582867

attributes.action: Hold a Referendum in Scotland to end Devolution
attributes.background: The Assembly at Holyrood is a waste of funds. It is a huge duplication and is not competent to manage simple tasks. The disastrous failures in hospitals, shipbuilding etc show how poor it is. HM Government should give the people of Scotland the chance to have it closed and to centralise operations.
attributes.additional_details: Holyrood is an expensive failed experiment. Scots are taxed higher than anybody else in UK yet have poorer services. Education, health and many other core services are floundering. The voting system does not see reflected in the chamber a fair perspective of the views of the people of Scotland. The devolved Assembly has failed in all but creating unwelcome and unnecessary division in Scotland. The population need the opportunity to confirm their rejection of it and demand it’s closure.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/333012

attributes.action: Ensure all advertised roles must list the salary or pay range in the job advert
attributes.background: Everyone has a threshold of what they cannot earn below in order to be able to survive. Job ads need to be transparent on pay.  On a regular basis, people spend hours applying and interviewing for roles they financially cannot accept and would never have applied for if the salary was advertised.
attributes.additional_details:
People are wasting countless hours of their time or being left out of pocket if they have to travel to interview. It's not realistic for someone to contact every Hiring Manager for every role, and it's still wasting their time!

Moreover, research suggests that 80% of job seekers will not apply for a job without the salary being listed - so this is impacting out jobs market and economy too.

https://www.businessleader.co.uk/almost-80-of-jobseekers-wont-apply-for-job-without-advertised-salary/

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/609260

attributes.action: Make Essential Medication Available To Sufferers Of Hyperhidrosis
attributes.background: Hyperhidrosis (excessive sweating) is an often overlooked condition, which is debilitating for those with it. It can however be treated with Propantheline, Oxybutynin, and Glycopyrronium. The latter of which is not available in the UK, despite being seen as the safest option.
attributes.additional_details: "NHS Dermatology have been prohibited by the CCG from treating or managing any cases of hyperhidrosis", this is a quote from a letter I received while trying to obtain Glycopyrronium to treat the condition that rules my life. It'd cost the NHS about £2000 a year to provide this medication to a patient, compared to the £5000 received in benefits a year being unable to work due to crippling anxiety caused by this condition, it's an active waste of money to not provide the life changing medication.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about treatment for sufferers of hyperhidrosis, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. There are a range of treatments for sufferers of hyperhidrosis available through the NHS. Treatment for individual patients is a matter for the NHS and individual clinicians, not the Government or House of Commons.

If you specifically want Glycopyrronium to be made available to all sufferers of hyperhidrosis, we could accept a petition calling on the Government to fund provision of this drug to all sufferers of hyperhidrosis, through the NHS.

attributes.action: Increase pay for existing Nurses and Healthcare Workers
attributes.background: Nurses & Healthcare Workers must have a pay rise which truly reflects their status in our Healthcare.  These staff need salaries which reflect their professionalism, qualifications, experience, knowledge and training in a socialist role to acknowledge their accountability and personal responsibility
attributes.additional_details:
Nurses and Healthcare Assistants are our very frontline medical staff.  They are underpaid for the work they do and the responsibility they carry, especially with Covid-19 and the threat to their health in caring for others.  
The NHS is top-heavy with highly-paid Directors, Managers and CCG staff, counting beans.  I know money is wasted in these areas - I have seen it when I worked for the NHS and CCG
These are the staff who are going to treat the nation and they should be rewarded accordingly.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Increase pay for NHS healthcare workers and recognise their work: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300073

Award all Nursing Staff in the NHS a pay rise of 10% backdated to 1 April 2020: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/316307

attributes.action: Audit finances of sadiq Khan's mayorship of London
attributes.background: Check the funding and management of mayor sadiq Khan as needing many bailouts is a serious concern for public financing, to ensure that the mayor has not mismanaged resources
attributes.additional_details: Complete audit of funding and finances and management of mayor sadiq Khan's mayorship as needing bailouts are a concern for waste of public money

rejection.details:
Scrutiny of the Mayor of London is a matter for the London Assembly, not the UK Government or House of Commons.

If you are concerned about the Mayor's job performance you could petition the London Assembly. You can find out how to petition the London Assembly here: https://www.london.gov.uk/about-us/london-assembly/petitions
